SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Simplify the Required Sharing Settings for Coupons

If your storefront supports coupons, continue to deliver trusted functionality and keep your storefront secure by default with less overhead. This release removes a requirement in your organization-wide default (OWD) external access settings for the B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects that support coupons.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: A critical update in Salesforce Summer ’19 automatically set the OWD external access for custom objects to Private. Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce required you to update the OWD external access for objects that affected the functionality that you support. For most objects, this updated access was Public Read Only. For coupons, you were required to adjust the OWD external access for the following objects even further to Public Read/Write:

CC Coupon
CC Product

However, a default external access value of Public Read/Write allowed for potential security vulnerabilities.

This release removes the Public Read/Write access requirement, and ensures that coupons function correctly when you leave the OWD external access set to Public Read Only.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, go to Sharing Settings from Setup. Find the Organization-Wide Defaults section, and update the Default External Access for the CC Coupon and CC Product objects to Public Read Only.

For new installations, the managed package sets the default external access for the affected objects to Public Read Only by default. No extra action is required.

SEE ALSO
Configure External Sharing Settings for Storefront Users
Update Sharing Settings for Coupons

title: Simplifying Coupon Sharing in B2B Commerce
